node.title: National Geographic photo prints for sale, with proceeds going to Ukraine relief
node.description: The women-owned nonprofit Vital Impacts is partnering with National Geographic photographers to raise money for Direct Relief.
node.content: ["When it comes to nature photography, few do it better than National Geographic photographers. Now you can buy a print of some of their photographs \u2014 and it's for a good cause.", "The women-owned nonprofit Vital Impacts has organized a sale of works by more than 100 National Geographic photographers, with 100% of the proceeds going to Direct Relief. The organization provides emergency medical assistance and disaster relief to regions across the globe, and is currently working in Ukraine amid the ongoing war with Russia.", "Below are some of the prints that are for sale.\u00a0", "The war in Ukraine has sparked the largest humanitarian crisis in Europe since World War II. Millions of Ukrainians have fled the country, while many more have been displaced within their homeland.\u00a0", "Officials across the globe \u2014 including President Biden \u2014 have accused Russia of committing war crimes. Ukrainian prosecutors have launched\u00a0investigations into 4,500 such claims, and other international organizations are also investigating the allegations.\u00a0", "Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy\u00a0told the United Nations Security Council\u00a0on Tuesday that Russia is intentionally killing civilians in his country, calling it a genocide.", "The Biden administration hasn't gone that far, but Britain's prime minister\u00a0said on Wednesday\u00a0that, \"what Putin has done in Ukraine doesn't look far short of genocide to me.\"", "The sale ends April 20."]
